title: Definitions relating to family relationships
context: §386-2 Definitions relating to family relationships. &ldquo;Brother&rdquo; or &ldquo;sister&rdquo; includes a half brother or half sister, a stepbrother or stepsister, and a brother or sister by adoption. &ldquo;Child&rdquo; includes a posthumous child, adopted child, stepchild, child born to parents not married to each other, and hanai child acknowledged prior to the personal injury. &ldquo;Grandchild&rdquo; includes a child of an adopted child and a child of a stepchild, but does not include a stepchild of a child. &ldquo;Grandparent&rdquo; includes a parent of a parent by adoption, but does not include a parent of a stepparent, a stepparent of a parent, or a stepparent of a stepparent. &ldquo;Parent&rdquo; includes a stepparent or a parent by adoption. [L 1963, c 116, pt of §1; Supp, §97-2; HRS §386-2; am L 1982, c 193, §1; am L 1997, c 52, §1] Revision Note Definitions rearranged pursuant to §23G-15. Attorney General Opinions Prior to 1982 amendment, benefits under workers&rsquo; compensation law did not extend to hanai children. Att. Gen. Op. 93-1. Case Notes Construed. 31 H. 814 (1931).
